sources.title: Captain Scarlett
sources.description: In the years following the fall of Napoleon, Captain Scarlett (Richard Greene) returns to France to discover that his lands have been seized by an unscrupulous nobleman. After saving Princess Maria (Leonora Amar) and being joined by a man named Pierre (Nedrick Young) who has also lost his lands, the group proceeds on a series of adventures in the fight for justice.

sources.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
sources.description: Captain Scarlett rescues Princess Maria from being abducted while travelling. She's not exactly grateful. He finds out that she is to be married to a man she doesn't like, so Captain Scarlet attempts to help her but winds up in prison for his efforts. He escapes and finally helps the reluctant bride who winds up joining Captain Scarlett and his sidekick and they become something along the lines of the three musketeers. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/captain-scarlett-1952/

sources.title: Captain Scarlett (1952) Adventure, Drama | Full Length Color Movie
sources.description:
The THRILL of Cold Steel! THE ROMANCE of Warm Lips! The EXCITEMENT of Blazing Adventure!
After the Napoleonic wars Captain Scarlett  returns to France to discover the tyranny Duke of Corlaine.  Scarlett helps Spanish Princess Maria, escape an arranged marriage, but he is arrested. and hatches a plan to break out & rescue the "Princess Bride" with the help of his cellmate; Pierre Du Cloux

Director: Thomas Carr 
Writer: Howard Dimsdale
Stars: Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young
Genres: Classics, Adventure, Drama

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Captain Scarlett returns from gallivanting around the country-side after the Napoleonic wars and finds life in southern France very different. He saves a beautiful princess from an arranged marriage to an evil count, protects many of the people from being persecuted by the Duke of Corlais, and eventually rids the country of the scourge of Corlais' power.
metadata.Actors: Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young
